dublinCore.dc:title: 116 HR 8460 IH: ATF Improvement and Modernization Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Beyer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To remove obstacles to the ability of law enforcement officers to enforce gun safety laws, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the ATF Improvement and Modernization Act of 2022 or the AIM Act.

section.header: Revising standard for Federal firearm license revocation from willful violation to knowing violation

subsection.text: Section 923(e) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking willfully each place the term appears and inserting knowingly.
The third sentence of section 923(e) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking Secretary’s and inserting Attorney General’s.

section.text: Section 923(f)(3) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the second sentence, by striking de novo; and
in the third sentence, by striking any evidence submitted by the parties to the proceeding whether or not such evidence and inserting only evidence that.
